results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Shuji Yamamoto, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini dragons. II”.
Indonesia, now the world’s 4th largest nation, has made rapid strides in economic development in the past decade, but not without cost both to traditional Indonesian culture and the natural environment. The impact of these economic changes is illustrated by profiling three of the “winners” in the new Indonesia - Bob Hasan, Indonesia’s “King of the Forest” and 10th richest man, who has made his fortune producing plywood for the Japanese from Indonesia’s rainforests; Francois, an entrepreneur hoping to develop a tourist resort on the still unspoiled island of Lombok; and finally, Rakhmat, a young aeronautical engineer who must leave his family in Indonesia to study overseas and advance his career.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shuji Yamamoto, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia

results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.

results.title: Indochine [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Paradis Films, La Generale D'Images, Bac Films (France), Orly Films, Cine 5, Eric Heumann, Jean Labadie and Regis Wargnier
results.brief_description: Set in 1930 in French Indochina, on the cusp of revolution, the 1993 Academy Award Winning Best Foreign Film, “Indochine” is the epic story of two women; a French mother and her adopted Indochinese daughter. Their relationship survives social and cultural obstacles, but is ultimately stretched to extremes by their passionate love for the same man. The awesome beauty of Vietnam provides a perfect backdrop for this splendid film. Catherine Deneuve gives a “tour de force” performance. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Indo-Australia cricket tests, 1964
results.brief_description: A survey of the tour of India by the Australian Test Team in 1964. Shows highlights of the matches played in various cities and the personalities associated with the tour. A very successful series of matches which drew large and enthusiastic crowds.
results.description: A survey of the tour of India by the Australian Test Team in 1964. Shows highlights of the matches played in various cities and the personalities associated with the tour. A very successful series of matches which drew large and enthusiastic crowds.

results.title: Individualised instruction
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre, University of New South Wales and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Considers the use of tape-slide combinations as a strategy for teaching large undergraduate classes. Two methods of utilisation are discussed. Considers underlying principles such as feedback and student participation, the practicalities of cost and program construction, and attempts to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of this medium.

results.title: Individual Skills Volleyball
results.brief_description: Key individual offensive skills are necessary to play effective Power Volleyball, Serve, serve reception, set and the attack are examined with practical examples in this program.

results.title: Individual progress in reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Reading Development”.
Examines the provision for individual progress in reading at two American schools. Two reading improvement specialists are seen operating different aspects of their respective reading programs. The schools are located on airbases in Oxfordshire.

results.title: Individual differences & developmental milestones
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Traces the course of sensorimotor development over the first year. Examines the results of comtemporary research on temperament, auditory and visual acuity, depth perception, phonemic discrimination and cross-modality matching. Presents newborns as they confront situations that allow them to exhibit their capacity to act, learn and remember.
